result.execSummary:
The defendant Vincent L. Melton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Vincent L. Melton is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Vincent L. Melton was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Not to consume any alcohol. Not to consume/possess any controlled substances unless prescribed by a licensed doctor. Not to go upon premises that serves alcohol for consumption on premises.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vincent L. Melton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Vincent L. Melton appeared with Attorney Samuel Louis Lawton.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.  Court calls case and appearances.  Atty Lawton offers a plea questionaire and waiver of rights form.  Court finds the def. freely and knowingly waives his rights.  Court finds there is a factual basis.
State speaks re: sentencing.  Atty Lawton speaks re: sentencing.  Def. speaks to the court. 
16 CM 86--Dismissed 

16 CM 119--Count 1-Dismissed
Count 2-Def. pleas no contest.  Court accepts plea and finds the def. guilty.  

14 CM 202--Court finds there is a factual basis to vacate the DJOC. 

Sentencing-2 years probation + costs  DNA Sample and Surcharge.  Conditions: Not to consume/possess any controlled substances unless prescribed. Not to consume any alcohol. Not to go upon premises that serves alcohol for consumption on premises.
